metadata.title: Expats Argentina - Complete Guide to Living in Argentina 2026
metadata.description: The honest expat guide to Argentina. Cost of living doubled, DNI delays 6+ months, mandatory travel insurance. Real 2026 information.

hero.title: Your Complete Guide to Living in Argentina
hero.subtitle: Not just Buenos Aires. From Patagonian lakes to Andean wine country, subtropical waterfalls to colonial Northwest towns — comprehensive expat guides for every corner of Argentina.
hero.description: Visas, cost of living, housing, healthcare, and honest advice for every province and major city in the country.

costOfLiving.title: Cost of Living Reality (2026)
costOfLiving.description: Argentina is no longer 'cheap'—prices have doubled since 2023. Budget $1,500-3,000/month for a comparable lifestyle. Inflation has stabilized at 2-3% monthly under Milei, but costs are now Western Europe level.

culturalRichness.title: Cultural Richness
culturalRichness.description: From tango in Buenos Aires to gaucho traditions on the Pampas, indigenous heritage in the Northwest, and Welsh colonies in Patagonia — every region has its own distinct identity.

naturalBeauty.title: Extraordinary Natural Beauty
naturalBeauty.description: Iguazu Falls, Patagonian glaciers, Andean peaks, subtropical forests, salt flats, and Lake District vistas. No country on Earth offers more geographic diversity.

visaOptions.title: Visa Options (With Caveats)
visaOptions.description: Digital Nomad (180 days only), Rentista, and Investment visas available. DNI processing now takes 6+ months. Citizenship requires 2 years of permanent residency (4-5 years total). Research carefully before choosing.

foodAndWine.title: Food and Wine Paradise
foodAndWine.description: The world's best beef, Malbec wine regions, empanadas that vary by province, Italian-influenced cuisine, and a dining culture where meals are social events to be savored.

welcoming.title: Welcoming Communities
welcoming.description: Argentines are famously warm and social. Established expat communities exist across the country, from Buenos Aires to Bariloche, Mendoza to Salta.

visas.title: Visas & Residency
visas.description: Digital nomad, rentista, investor, and retirement visa guides with real application timelines.

costOfLiving.title: Cost of Living
costOfLiving.description: Monthly budgets for every major city, factoring in inflation, exchange rates, and the real costs.

healthcare.title: Healthcare (2026 Rules)
healthcare.description: Mandatory travel insurance required for entry. Public hospitals now charge foreigners. Prepaga system explained with updated 2026 pricing.

housing.title: Housing & Rentals
housing.description: Finding apartments without a garantia, rental contracts, and neighborhood guides for every city.

banking.title: Banking & Money
banking.description: Exchange rates, opening accounts, sending money internationally, and navigating the peso economy.

safety.title: Safety
safety.description: Real safety data by province and city, common scams to avoid, and practical precautions.

transportation.title: Transportation
transportation.description: Getting around Argentina—buses, flights, subways, and the SUBE card system.

food.title: Food & Dining
food.description: Argentine cuisine, restaurant etiquette, grocery shopping, and the dining culture.

remoteWork.title: Remote Work
remoteWork.description: Coworking spaces, internet speeds, and working remotely from Argentina.

learnSpanish.title: Learn Spanish
learnSpanish.description: Language schools, Rioplatense vs. standard Spanish, and immersion strategies that work.

culture.title: Culture & Customs
culture.description: Mate rituals, asado etiquette, and navigating Argentine social norms.

socialLife.title: Expat Social Life
socialLife.description: Meetup groups, language exchanges, sports clubs, and building your community.

newsletter.title: Get the Latest Updates
newsletter.description: Visa changes, cost of living updates, and insider tips delivered to your inbox. No spam, unsubscribe anytime.
newsletter.joinCount: Join 2,000+ expats getting weekly Argentina updates.

cities.title: Featured Cities
cities.subtitle: Detailed guides for Argentina's most popular destinations for expats.

regions.title: Argentina's 6 Regions
regions.subtitle: From subtropical jungles to Antarctic glaciers, Argentina has it all.

costOfLiving.title: Cost of Living in Argentina 2026
costOfLiving.subtitle: The 'cheap Argentina' era is OVER. Prices have doubled since 2023.
costOfLiving.description: Real 2026 budgets for Buenos Aires—now rivaling Western Europe.

realityCheck.title: 2026 Reality Check: Argentina Is NOT Cheap Anymore
realityCheck.description: Prices have doubled since 2023. Buenos Aires now rivals Lisbon or Barcelona in prices.

healthcare.title: Healthcare in Argentina 2026
healthcare.subtitle: Updated 2026 healthcare guide: mandatory travel insurance for entry, public hospitals now charge foreigners.

alert.title: 2026 Critical Update: New Healthcare Rules
alert.mandatoryInsurance: Mandatory Travel Insurance: Effective July 2025, all visitors must show proof of health insurance at immigration.
alert.publicHospitals: Public Hospitals Charge Foreigners: The 'free healthcare for all' era has ended.
alert.higherCosts: Higher Insurance Costs: Prepaga prices have increased 50-75% since 2023.

visas.title: Argentina Visa Guide & Decision Tool
visas.subtitle: Find the right visa, calculate costs, estimate timelines, and learn from people who've actually gone through the process.

alert.title: 2026 Visa Reality: Delays & Processing Updates
alert.dniDelays: DNI Delays: National ID processing is taking 6+ months due to system backlogs.
alert.citizenship: 2-Year Citizenship Rule: Citizenship requires 2 years of permanent residency (not temporary). Total: 4-5 years.
alert.digitalNomad: Digital Nomad Visa: Only 180 days with no direct residency path.

banking.title: Banking & Money in Argentina
banking.subtitle: Navigate Argentina's unique financial landscape. Understanding the blue dollar, transferring money, and managing finances as an expat.

noDni.title: Banking Without DNI (2026 Workarounds)
noDni.description: DNI processing is taking 6+ months. Here's how to function financially without it.

safety.title: Safety in Buenos Aires (2026)
safety.subtitle: The honest truth: Palermo, Recoleta & Belgrano are very safe. Petty theft (phone snatching) is the main risk—not violent crime.
safety.reality: Safety Reality: Palermo, Recoleta & Belgrano Are Very Safe
safety.realityDescription: Despite media sensationalism, these neighborhoods have crime rates comparable to European cities.

neighborhoods.title: Best Neighborhoods for Expats
neighborhoods.subtitle: Find your perfect barrio in Buenos Aires. Updated 2026 rent prices (doubled since 2023), safety rankings, and honest assessments.

petImportation.title: Bringing Your Pet to Argentina
petImportation.subtitle: The good news: there is no quarantine for cats and dogs from most countries. The paperwork is manageable.

noQuarantine.title: No Quarantine Required
noQuarantine.description: Unlike Australia, Japan, or the UK, Argentina does NOT require quarantine for cats and dogs from most countries.

footer.description: Your honest, comprehensive guide to living in Argentina. Real information from real expats.
